name: Expansio
description:
We are a Polish software house with the "turquoise company" management model.
We have a vast background in the area of web applications and mobile software. We specialize in creating software and hardware startups. We developed B2C and B2B startup products, such as:
Enter the game (http://www.expans.io/enter-the-game/), an educational project for the employees of Volkswagen Poznań
CodeAll (http://codeall.fun) - startup focused on teaching programming using IoT devices, winner of many awards
Tinkerer (http://www.expans.io/tinkerer/) - beacons for the industry
Our startup projects were selected to many acceleration programs, such as Swiss Kickstart Accelerator, Google Launchpad Start, Startup Spark or MIT Enterprise Forum Poland. We have won the Edulab competition as the best educational startup in Poland (1 000 000 PLN of investment) and were granted more than 1 500 000 PLN by the Polish National Centre for Research and Development. 
Founder of Expansio, Mateusz Jarus, has actively contributed to research work for more than 7 years. He is the co-author of 15 publications. His research work has been presented at multiple conferences around the world.
Mateusz Jarus is the alumni of TOP 500 Innovators Programme at Cambridge University. He is also the alumni of Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) Programme at the Center for Research Computing, University of Notre Dame, USA.
Expansio has developed multiple software and hardware projects in the following areas:
e-learning,
law,
advertisement,
company management.
We specialize in the following technologies: React, React Native, JavaScript and PHP.
